summary: This document is an email chain from July 2020 between attorneys and a U.S. Attorney's Office regarding an ongoing investigation. The prosecutors are seeking to ask a client (Mr. [Redacted]) about his potential recognition of and relationship with a U.S. Customs and Border Protection employee named [Redacted], who is suspected of having a friendship with Jeffrey Epstein and accompanying him on trips in the Virgin Islands.

persons.name: Glen G. McGorty
persons.context: Attorney representing a client referred to as 'Mr. [Redacted]' and communicating with the U.S. Attorney's Office regarding an investigation. He coordinates calls and conveys information.

persons.name: Donnie Murrell
persons.context: Attorney who was previously contacted in 2019 regarding a meeting with a client. The 2020 email chain is forwarded to him, and he is referenced as a past point of contact.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named as an individual with whom the subject of the investigation (a CBP employee) may have had a friendship. Mentioned in the context of trips and visits to his Virgin Islands home.

connections.description: McGorty is the attorney representing the unnamed client, referred to as 'Mr. [Redacted]', in communications with federal prosecutors.
The CBP employee is suspected of having a friendship with Epstein, having been to his Virgin Islands home and accompanied him on boat, helicopter, and/or plane trips.
Prosecutors are investigating whether the client, Mr. [Redacted], knows the CBP employee, as the employee was listed as a contact in his phone and may have introduced individuals to him.

events.title: Scheduled call between attorneys and prosecutors
events.description: A call is scheduled for 2:00 p.m. to discuss whether the client recognizes a photo of a CBP employee and to convey additional investigative information.

events.title: Reference to 'recent developments' and office support
events.description: McGorty references 'crazy times' and 'recent developments' that prompted public support from alumni for the U.S. Attorney's Office as an institution.

events.title: Tentative planned meeting week
events.description: In August 2019, prosecutors tentatively planned a meeting for the week of the 19th with Donnie Murrell's client, which was later disrupted.

keyFacts: Prosecutors are investigating a U.S. Customs and Border Protection (CBP) employee who worked in Saint Thomas and may have had a friendship with Jeffrey Epstein.
The CBP employee is alleged to have visited Epstein's Virgin Islands home and accompanied him on boat, helicopter, and/or plane trips.
The investigation seeks to determine if a separate individual (the attorney's client) knows this CBP employee, as the employee was listed as a contact in the client's phone.
The email chain highlights the use of attorney intermediaries to convey investigative questions to a client during an ongoing probe.
The correspondence is marked as 'Privileged and Confidential • Attorney-Client Communication • Attorney Work Product'.
